channel.title: [317][Delta)Couple Thnigs[317]
channel.description:
[size=12pt][b]I have 5 question's
-How can i make my ::pure command only be able to use it once? -When i spawn noted sara brews and try adding them in bank they stay noted, how can i make them not noted? -How can i make a in-game HighScore for pk points(give me link if theres any TUTS) -I have added a pk shop, but i wanna buy the items with pk points, how can i do this? -How can i make a Object i touch must kill 20 npc's???
please help, and before posting use search botton yes i have searched.[/b][/size]

item.title: [317][Delta)Couple Thnigs[317]
item.dc:creator: @aekramer aekramer
item.description:
@aekramer wrote:

  1. Try searching for tutorials for creating ranks, add a rank named “usedPure”
    then add this to your command:
if(command.startsWith("pure") {
if(pure == 0){
[i]the exp giving part here[/i]
} else {
sM("You can only use this command once!");
}
}

Please use both brackets at the end, else you will get 100 errors,

  1. This is probably just your items in client, just spawn unnoted items.

  2. For the PKP shop, there are plenty of Tut’s around, use Google

  3. Again, add a rank named “testKillcount”, you can change the name put you will need to change it everywhere in the next code too…
    Then go to your if(ObjectID == …){ code and make it like this:

if(ObjectID == @@@@){ //replace @@@@ with object ID
if(testKillcount >= 20){ //this will check if you have killed 20 or more monsters
[i]what you want your object to do if there is a 20 Killcount[/i]
} else { //else..
sM("You need 20 killcount before doing this!"); //tells player he needs 20 Kc
sM("You currently have " + testKillcount + " Killcount!"); //tells player current KC..
}
}

Now for the killcount to work go to your NPCHandler class and search for “if(npcs[i].npcType ==”
and right above that add this:

if(npcs[i].npcType == ####){ //Replace #### with NPC ID if(temp.gwdkc == 20) { //Checks if killcount is already 20 temp.sM("Your Killcount is already 20!"); //Tells player his killcount is already 20.. } else { //else.. temp.gwdkc += 1; //Adds his killcount +1 if the player has killed the NPC temp.sM("Your Killcount is now: "+temp.testKillcount+"."); //this tells the player his current killcount } }

Note: Don’t remove the “temp.” this makes it so it happens after the NPC is killed

Also if you can’t work this out, I would say you need to learn some more Java first and retry later on… This is just really C+P

Read full topic
